$JOBY said it has received its first CAE-built flight simulator set to be installed this month in California to train electric air taxi pilots.

Joby expects FAA qualification as a Level 7 training device with a full-motion Level C simulator coming later this year.

Stanley Druckenmiller said he‚Äôs not sure he‚Äôs ever made money shorting even when markets looked expensive.

It‚Äôs almost always better to own great businesses than try to short bad ones.

$NBIS plans to deploy ~80MW of new data center capacity in Israel. 

The buildout ramps from Q3 through early 2027 and implies roughly a 10x expansion of Nebius‚Äô Israel footprint within about a year.

$MU plans to ramp HBM4 to ~15k wafers per month this year which is ~30% of its ~55k total capacity as $NVDA Vera Rubin moves into production.

More HBM means more GPUs can actually be deployed & used efficiently which eases one of the biggest constraints on AI training & inference growth.

$TSLA CEO Elon Musk said it will take several years for FSD to be clearly safer than humans and even longer for legacy automakers to integrate AI hardware at scale.

As a result, he sees any real competitive pressure from $NVDA Alpamayo showing up in 5-6 years at the earliest.

$NVDA CEO Jensen Huang just announced Alpamayo which he calls the world‚Äôs first thinking and reasoning model built for autonomous vehicles.

By open sourcing the Alpamayo stack, Nvidia is pushing self driving forward as a category after years of work by thousands of engineers.

Goldman Sachs expects global humanoid robot market to reach $38B within next decade.

‚Ä¢ $NVDA supplying the intelligence layer
‚Ä¢ $AMZN automating the logistics layer
‚Ä¢ $TSLA building physical embodiment layer
‚Ä¢ $PLTR coordinating the control layer

Nvidia $NVDA announced that its Rubin platform is in full production, and chips will be available in the second half of 2026.

Microsoft, Google Cloud, AWS, Oracle Cloud, CoreWeave, Nebius, Lambda and Nscale will be among the first to offer the new platform to customers.

The hardest part of scaling AI isn‚Äôt building faster chips, it‚Äôs connecting them reliably at scale. 

For our premium members, we recently recapped one company centered around the reliability at scale trend that delivered another wildly impressive earnings report this past quarter. 
io-fund.com/premium-services‚Ä¶
$NVDA $AMD $AVGO

Foxconn's December revenue rose 31.8% YoY to ~$27.4 billion, accelerating from 25.5% growth in November on strong AI server demand. 

Q4 revenue was up 22% YoY to $82.7 billion, above estimates for roughly $77 billion, with Foxconn expecting AI server momentum to continue in Q1.

$NVDA $AAPL

This substantial performance upgrade means the $NVDA GB200 can offer inference performance at 1/15th the cost per token as other GPU options, per Signal65.

$AMD

Samsung and SK Hynix are reportedly looking to raise server DRAM prices by as much as 70% in Q1 on strong demand and tight supply. 

$MU $NVDA $AMD

Nvidia‚Äôs $NVDA GB200 NVL72 delivers up to 6.5x the performance of the B200 and up to 28x the performance of AMD‚Äôs $AMD MI355X on reasoning on DeepSeek‚Äôs R1 model, with throughput of 7,707 tokens per second, vs 1,176 on the B200 and 272 on the MI355X, at 75 tokens per second per user.

The market is starting 2026 on a solid footing, with strong participation beyond just mega-cap tech.
$SPY is hovering near key levels; as long as it holds recent support, staying long remains straightforward. 

The bigger focus is on tech: as long as $QQQ holds around the $616 area, tech isn‚Äôt a drag‚Äîeven if it lags. A breakdown below that level would create more headwinds.

Small caps $IWM are back in favor, while $XLE also performed well but looks extended short term and may need consolidation.

Stay flexible as leadership rotates across sectors.
